prompt: If region x is SE of region y and region y is S of region z, then which could be the possible relations between region x and region z?
answer:
Sitting “below” z is guaranteed (since x is SE of y and y is S of z, it follows that x is also below z).  Horizontally, however, x could either still lie within z’s bounding box or lie entirely to the right of z’s bounding box.  In the single‐tile relations given, those two cases correspond exactly to x being S of z (if it is horizontally contained in z) or SE of z (if it is also to the right).  

Hence, the only possible single‐tile relations of x to z are S or SE.
